body.p:
Bedford Ky May 2. 1865
To His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Commonwealth of Kentucky
your petitioner Benton Gatewood would respectfully represent, that at the May term of the circuit court for Trimble county, he was fined the sum of Thirty Dollars for pitching a game of Dollars,
He says that he was not aware that he was subject to a fine for merely pitching as he did for a treat, it being merely for amusement as he believed,
He therefore prays your honor to remit said fine and as in duty bound will ever pray &C. &C,
We the undersigned citizens of Trimble co Ky, join the petition in his prayer &C

F. E. Skidmore
F Willis Sheriff T. C.
R. Bell
B R. Spencer
Alex. Cook
Frank Skidmore
William Skidmore
W R Goode
A R Ewing
Thos E T Peek
W. J. Wright
J. B. Pierce
L. G. Peak
F A Adams

Sir the within petitioner Bent Gatewood is a friend of Mine and I would like verry Much for you to lay his case to ^before^ the Governor Gatewood is a poor man and I would feel agreaved to see him put in Jail for so Small of fees Should you succed in having Said fine remitted and send me the papers I will send the fee Two dollar by Mail forthwith

Trimble Cir Ct
vs
B. Gatewood
$30 --
Remit
23d May/65
